name: Dolphin
description: A highly social, intelligent marine mammal known for its agility and playfulness.
behaviour: Very social; forms pods and uses complex vocal communication and hunting strategies.
quickInfo: Dolphins have unique signature whistles they use like names to identify each other.

name: Hammerhead Shark
description: Distinctive T-shaped head; often found in warm coastal waters and known for schooling behavior in some species.
behaviour: Often migratory; some species form large schools by day.
quickInfo: Hammerheads' wide heads improve sensory perception — helping them detect prey buried in sand.

name: White Shark
description: A shark variant model included for visualization and testing.
behaviour: No data — placeholder entry for model preview.
quickInfo: Sharks have existed for over 400 million years — long before dinosaurs.

name: Atlantic Bluefin Tuna
description: Fast-swimming pelagic fish prized by commercial and sport fisheries.
behaviour: Highly migratory and forms schools; powerful sustained swimmers.
quickInfo: Some tuna species can keep parts of their bodies warmer than the surrounding water to swim faster.

name: Blue Whale
description: Large marine mammal model used for scale and visualization in the viewer.
behaviour: Large, often social mammals with complex behaviors; used here as a model asset.
quickInfo: Some whales produce low-frequency songs that can travel across entire ocean basins.
